page.title: 05LLANSTADWELL CHURCH
page.content: {Llanstadwell Church,}dedicated to St.Tudwal, was built in{1291 AD.}Some people think that Tudwal was Scandinavian and he is invoked in Brittany in times of need. The only parts of the original church which remain are the tower and the Holy Water stoop in the Sanctuary. The tower is thought to have been a watchtower for it has a commanding view over the Haven. The church was not originally cruciform in shape, having a Nave, a Chancel and a large Transeptal chapel on the north side. In{1853,}it was{rebuilt}and is now orthodox in shape. The church once belonged to St. Thomas's Priory in Haverfordwest. It now belongs to the {Church in Wales}and is used as a place of worship. by Andrew Cole
